node.Title: Twitter Sparrow tackles data storage challenges of scale
node.Description: In this blog post, we discuss the scale at which Twitter operates through Project Sparrow, an initiative that shifted the architecture of our data pipelines from a batch event approach to streaming.

node.Title: Over-squashing, Bottlenecks, and Graph Ricci curvature
node.Description: Over-squashing is a common plight of Graph Neural Networks. In this post, we discuss how this phenomenon can be understood and remedied through the concept of Ricci curvature.

node.Description: In this blog, we share findings from a follow-up analysis in which we seek to understand how prompts cause people to reconsider potentially harmful or offensive content before they hit send.

node.Title: Understanding Twitter conversations: A Wordle case study
node.Description: On the Data Science team, a piece of our job is understanding how conversations are happening on Twitter. In this blog, we use Wordle as a case study to showcase how we think about similar analyses.

node.Title: Graph machine learning with missing node features

node.Title: Data transfer in Manhattan using RocksDB

node.Title: Next generation data insights using natural language queries
node.Description: In this blog, we share details about how we built an in-house product called Qurious, which allows our internal customers to get answers to their analytical queries through natural language questions.

node.Title: Introducing a new Swift package for Apache Thrift
node.Description: Twitter’s new Thrift library is an open-source, standalone, lightweight, data encoding library. In this blog, we share our library so iOS developers outside Twitter can start using Thrift data.
